snippet: In 2011 the Department of Education paid $1.4 billion to collection agencies to find defaulters, a group that includes nearly one in six borrowers with a balance.
abstract: Federal Education Department has paid $1.4 billion to collection agencies to find student loan defaulters and has extended its tools for collection to the collection firms, resulting in the astounding rate of recouping almost 80 cents for every dollar that goes into default; critics say the successful recovery rate leaves the government with little incentive to try to prevent student loan defaults in the first place, even as one in every six student borrowers with a loan balance is in default (Series: Degrees of Debt).
lead_paragraph: In 2011 the Department of Education paid $1.4 billion to collection agencies to find defaulters, a group that includes nearly one in six borrowers with a balance.
